blackberry.title: BlackBerry
blackberry.welcomeMsgSecond: There are a number of mobile solutions to provide you with more flexibility in the way you work. Using the Mobile self-service tool on My Hub, you can easily manage your Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) registered devices, install core UBS business applications, and review step-by-step guides to help optimize your mobile experience.
blackberry.createNewkeyInfo: To add a new personal mobile device requires a new Access Key.
blackberry.removeDeviceConfirmText: Are you sure you want to remove this device from BYOD and wipe the UBS data from the device? To add the device again will require a new Access Key

home.assistDescription: Assist is a knowledge base which helps you learn and understand about UBS systems.
home.mobileDescription: My Hub is available for you to use on both desktop and mobile devices. The Mobile page contains all your connection and device information.
home.mycomputerDescription: The My Computer page contains all the information you'll need to manage your desktop.
home.mystatusDescription: Hosts your service items (IT support tickets, requests and approvals), and allows you to search (SNOW, BBS, ARP and MAC).
home.emptyStatusMessage: You have no current status items
home.passwordDescription: The Passwords option helps you manage your password information. There are separate options for your various desktop passwords and an A-Z finder.
home.peopledirectoryDescription: Contains contact and location information for everyone at UBS. You can search colleagues by name, interact with them online (including email) and also view their position in the organization.
home.disclaimerMessageText: Please note that your Service Status on My Hub may be impacted.

my-status.CID: Customer Identifying Data (CID) and UBS employee data not available in Who is Who must not be entered in this ticket.{{value}}To protect our clients confidentiality and to comply with various data protection, privacy, and banking secrecy laws, your problem description and attachments must not contain data which identifies your client. No Customer Identifying Data (CID) or UBS Employee Data not available in Who is Who is allowed in this support ticket. Client Identifying Data is any data provided from or relating to UBS clients, prospects or employees (if they are UBS clients) which allows the deduction of the existence of a banking relationship between the client and UBS. Please contact your local security officer (http://goto/lso) if you are unsure or have any queries about this, before creating your ticket.

myComputer.descriptionSecond: With tools to request or remove applications from the centralized App Store, manage your e-mail distribution lists or checking your remote readiness, managing your desktop has never been easier. Discover all that’s available to you on My Computer.

workremote.skype-text1: With many of us currently working remotely, small changes we make can vastly improve the quality of our technology services - especially Skype for Business.
workremote.skype-text2: How can I ensure optimal Skype performance?
workremote.skype-text3: Always use an approved headset when on a Skype call when working remotely. If you use your personal PC or laptop's built-in speakers, other participants will experience an echo and find it hard to hear you.
workremote.skype-text4: After ending a call you should close the window, as well as any chat/IM tabs that you aren't using. This will free up more space on the network and improve performance.
workremote.skype-text5: If you're using video when working remotely and experiencing connection problems, turn off your video and use audio only.
workremote.myhubexternal-text2: is designed to be a safety net if you're working remotely and need assistance logging in.
workremote.myhub-text1: When you need help, you want it fast. And with our technology service desks seeing increased volumes, you should know that for most of the common tech issues that we face at UBS, there's already a solution you can use right away—My Hub.
workremote.myhub-text2: My Hub is full of self-service resources that you can use. Best of all, My Hub is available in the office, at home or on-the-go, whether you're logged in or not, to serve you whenever and wherever you may need. Learn more about the various access points for My Hub below:

remote-wizard.tHeader: We have found the following information
remote-wizard.t1: This page will guide you through the required actions for working remotely.
remote-wizard.enforcedReminder: You must only use UBS SecurePass or UBS MobilePass when logging in
remote-wizard.workspace-ineligible: You are not yet entitled to access your Workspace remotely.
remote-wizard.workspace-eligible-msg: You are eligible to request a new Workspace platform.
remote-wizard.workspace-eligible-msg-2: Workspace is the latest platform for UBS personnel to work remotely using our latest methods of authentication MobilePass and SecurePass.
remote-wizard.workspace-ordered: Your order has been placed. It will take 24 to 36 hours to get entitled after your request is approved.
remote-wizard.workspace-entitle-msg: You are entitled to access your desktop remotely.
remote-wizard.workspace-entitle-msg-2: You need either UBS MobilePass or UBS SecurePass to access your Workspace or A3 remotely.
remote-wizard.desktop-entitled: You can access some of your core applications when working remotely from your personal device by using ConnectLite.
remote-wizard.desktop-entitled-2: From a browser on your personal device you can visit ubs.com/connectlite to log in and access your applications.
remote-wizard.desktop-entitled-3: To remotely connect to your full desktop using your personal device, you need to raise a request and provide a business case for doing so.
remote-wizard.desktop-not-entitled: You are currently not entitled to access your desktop remotely.
remote-wizard.laptop-not-entitled: You are currently not entitled to access your laptop remotely.
remote-wizard.laptop-entitled: You are entitled to use a UBS Corporate Laptop when working remotely. To log in, you need to use the ConnectMe software that is already installed on UBS Corporate Laptops by default.
remote-wizard.laptop-entitled-4: If you have a business case, you can also raise a request for standard plus entitlement.
remote-wizard.laptop-entitled-2: You will need to use the Connect Me Software that is installed on UBS laptop by default.
remote-wizard.laptop-entitled-3: You will also need to install and activate the 'Remote Work' app to login.
remote-wizard.request-submitted: Request with reference {{value}} has been submitted and is pending approval.
remote-wizard.request-submitted-2: Requests can take 24-36 hours to be granted.
remote-wizard.msg8: Unfortunately an error occurred while creating your request.
remote-wizard.msg10: Not allowed for all Member of Business Division Global Wealth Management
remote-wizard.msg11: Not allowed for Business Division Asset Management Switzerland
remote-wizard.msg13: Swiss Red Zone users are not able to access Connect Lite from outside Switzerland
remote-wizard.msg14: Access to Smart Card protected data is not possible, including access to Smart Card enforced applications or group shares
remote-wizard.wma-1: How to raise a request in MAC
remote-wizard.tooltipConnectMe: Connect your UBS Laptop to the UBS network remotely, from home or public hotspot over a UBS VPN WLAN.
remote-wizard.tooltipConnectLite1: Connect Lite enables mobile workers to connect quickly and easily from anywhere in the world to the applications they need.
remote-wizard.tooltipConnectLite2: This is the new SCG Lite solution for DTP. Define Connect My Apps, My Desktop, MyRDP as Alias for Connect Lite.
remote-wizard.tooltipWorkspace: Workspace: Remotely connect to your UBS Workspace next generation desktop platform.
remote-wizard.tooltipA3: A3: Remotely access any application, on any device, from any location using your A3 desktop session.

password.beAdvised: Please be advised that the Password Wizard requires Outlook and Skype to be closed.
password.descriptionFirst: Create, unlock and reset your account passwords
password.descriptionSecond: With access to My Hub Passwords from the office and at home, you can quickly regain access to your desktop when your account is locked. This tool allows you to easily browse password systems and learn how to better manage them. You can also run the password wizard to reset your desktop account, find the expiry date, and create new passwords or reset forgotten passwords.
password.didYouKnowDescriptionStart: That you can change both WebSSO and Windows passwords at the same time using
password.ensureAnyWork: Ensure any work is saved and close these before progressing.

password.passwordExpire: Your password will expire in {{value}} days.
password.passwordWizardDescription: The Password Wizard should be used to synchronise all of your accounts seamlessly across UBS.
password.useSearch: Use Search or A-Z tool to find the relevant self-service link.
password.useThisOptionReset: Use this option if you want to reset and unlock your Desktop Password.
password.useThisOptionUnlock: Use this option if you just want to unlock your account and continue using your current Password.

Android is an array of software intended for mobile devices which feature an operating system. An Android device may be a smartphone or tablet PC, including Samsung, LG, Google Pixel, Sony, HTC, Huawei and many more.
pointsharp.wizardChooseDeviceType: Choose the device you're installing PointSharp:
pointsharp.wizardiOSMobileInfo: iOS is a mobile operating system created and developed by Apple Inc. exclusively for its hardware. It is the operating system which currently powers many of the company's mobile devices, including the iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.

pointsharp.infoLoginApp: For every new device you would like to have a Skype for business, you'll need to register it in myhub and install the PointSharp Login app to provide that security.

stepOne.title: Step One
stepOne.wizardWifiSignalAndFollow: Make sure you have a strong Wi-Fi connection or carrier signal and follow the steps below to download the 'PointSharp Login' app.
stepOne.downloadLoginApp: Search for {{ value }} and download it to your device
stepOne.allowNotifications: When prompted, allow the app to send you notifications and access your camera.

stepOne.clickNext: Click the next button below to continue

stepTwo.title: Step Two
stepTwo.description: Once you have downloaded the PointSharp Login app you will need to scan a QR code to configure the application with our servers and your account.
stepTwo.followStepsBelow: Follow the steps below to do this
stepTwo.rule3: Scan the QR code shown on the left by pointing your phone at the code
stepTwo.rule4: When you have scanned the QR code you will automatically be taken to the next step

stepThree.title: Step Three
stepThree.readyToInstallSkype: You're now ready to install and use Skype for Business on your mobile device.
stepThree.receivePIN: You should already know your 4 digit pin or have received this via email if this is a brand new account.
stepThree.downloadSkypeApp: Search for {{ value }} and download it to your device
stepThree.enterEmail: Enter your sign-in email address and click blue arrow
stepThree.whenPrompted: When prompted enter your 4 digit pin, click save password and click to login
stepThree.receivePush: You will receive a push notification for Biometrics to confirm your sign in attempt
stepThree.useBiomteric: Open this notification and use your biometrics to unlock the app
stepThree.confirm3: and the switch back to Skype for business where you will be signed in automatically

Your device list will be updated with the device you add after you confirm and agree to the prerequisites and migrate to the new PointSharp functionality.

ubsmyhub.mhmp1: My Hub Mobile is the mobile version of the goto/myhub site. Once you have it installed, you will be able to change your password, view your tickets, manage your requests and approvals, see the people directory and more.
ubsmyhub.mhmli1: You must have BlackBerry Work installed on your device.
ubsmyhub.mhmli2: If you have any BlackBerry applications on your device (Work, Connect, Access etc.) they must be active (have been used in the last 60 days) or activation of My Hub Mobile will fail. Please either log in or delete the applications before downloading My Hub Mobile.
ubsmyhub.prerequisite: A prerequisite for UBS My Hub installation is a Blackberry Dynamics account. To request an account, proceed to the Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) page and follow the instructions.
ubsmyhub.installationbeforeproceed: UBS My Hub Installation - Before proceeding
ubsmyhub.blackberrycontainer: UBS My Hub uses the BlackBerry container, Blackberry applications may become inactive: If you haven't used a Blackberry mobile application (Work, Access, Docs to Go or Connect) in the last 60 days, please remove these before proceeding.
ubsmyhub.haventusedblackberry: Expired BlackBerry applications may prevent UBS My Hub mobile activation:
ubsmyhub.removeappinstruction: If you have one or more BlackBerry applications (such as Work, Access, Docs to Go or Connect) that have been used in the last 60 days, activation will succeed.
ubsmyhub.office365instruction: If all of your BlackBerry applications have expired (not used in 60 days), even where only a single BlackBerry application has been installed and not used, activation will fail.
ubsmyhub.removeblackberry: Please remove expired BlackBerry applications where necessary before proceeding.
ubsmyhub.altiosvideo: Uninstall Blackberry Suite on iSO video
ubsmyhub.altandriodvideo: Uninstall Blackberry Suite on Android video
ubsmyhub.mobileapplicationoffering: UBS My Hub is a mobile application offering the functionality of My Hub with added content and features in a convenient mobile application. Please select your device's operating system from the list below to continue installation of the application.
ubsmyhub.iosmobileinfo: iOS is a mobile operating system created and developed by Apple Inc. exclusively for its hardware. It is the operating system which currently powers many of the company's mobile devices, including the iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.
ubsmyhub.androidmobileinfo: An Android device is a device that runs on the Android operating system. Android is an array of software intended for mobile devices which feature an operating system. An Android device may be a smartphone or tablet PC, including Samsung, LG, Google Pixel, Sony, HTC, Huawei and many more.
ubsmyhub.continuewith: To continue with the installation, select whether you have BlackBerry Work installed.
ubsmyhub.wifisignal: Make sure you have a strong Wi-Fi or carrier signal.
ubsmyhub.installfromappstore: Install 'UBS My Hub' from the App Store and launch.
ubsmyhub.setupblackberry: Set up with 'BlackBerry Work' when prompted.
ubsmyhub.enterpassword: Enter a new password if prompted.
ubsmyhub.generatekeyinstallation: generate a new key when prompted during the installation process.

office365.landingH1: Installation guides for Office 365 mobile apps
office365.landingText1: You can now install any Office 365 application on your personal mobile device by following the instructions below.
office365.landingText2: Ensure you select the correct platform (Android or iOS).
office365.landingText4: we recommend installing your mobile apps in the order listed.
office365.landingAlert: Your PIN and phone number have been set but you can change them anytime.

manageAccount.title: Office 365 Mobile Applications Activation
manageAccount.text0: Before setting up any Office 365 applications on your personal mobile device, please first set up your Authentication PIN and register your mobile phone number.
manageAccount.pinSetAlert: You must create an Authentication PIN before you can set up and use any Office 365 mobile apps.
manageAccount.text2: Once your Authentication PIN has been set you can change it any time here.
manageAccount.text1: You must set your PIN here.
manageAccount.phoneSetAlert: You must add your mobile phone number before you can set up and use any Office 365 mobile apps.
manageAccount.pinNotMatch: These PINs do not match. Please re-enter the PIN.
manageAccount.pinSuccess: Your Authentication PIN has been changed successfully.
manageAccount.pinSuccess2: Make a note of your PIN as you will need it to enrol your device and access Office 365 applications with your UBS account.
manageAccount.pinPresetSuccess: Your Authentication PIN has been set but you can change it any time.
manageAccount.nAccepted: Your mobile number has been set successfully.
manageAccount.mtext1: Enter your mobile number including the international prefix
manageAccount.mtext2: During application setup, an additional temporary verification code is sent via SMS to your mobile phone.
manageAccount.mtext4: To change your mobile number, select its international code from the list, then type the rest of your new number. Your number will not be changed until you submit the new number.
manageAccount.criteriaPIN: Your Authentication PIN must be at least six digits long and it cannot contain a sequence within the phone number of four or more digits, nor any three (or more) repeating digits (e.g. 000, 1111), nor three or more sequential digits (e.g. 123, 4321). Your PIN will not change until you confirm and submit a new PIN.
manageAccount.weakError: This PIN is not strong enough. Please try again.

step1.heading: Install Microsoft Apps
step1.text1: Microsoft Authenticator is required in order to use Outlook on your device.
step1.text2: Download the Microsoft Authenticator and Outlook applications from your Apple App Store.
step1.text3: Install Authenticator but do not sign in to the application.

step2.heading: Add your account
step2.text1: If Outlook finds an existing account that uses your UBS email address select 'Add Account'. If Outlook finds and offers to add any non-UBS email addresses to this account, deselect these and select 'Skip'.
step2.text2: Otherwise enter your UBS email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) and select 'Add Account'.
step2.text3: You will be prompted to open the Authenticator application. Tap 'Open Authenticator'.
step2.text4: Acknowledge any notification prompts displayed. Outlook may then close. If so, relaunch it.

step3.heading: Sign in and verify your account
step3.text1: You will be redirected to the UBS sign in page showing your email address. Tap 'Next'
step3.text2: A verification code will then be sent by SMS to the mobile phone you provided the number for in the pre-requisite Activation step.
step3.text3: Please note: the SMS sender may be displayed as 'SmsVerify' rather than Microsoft.
step3.text4: Enter the six digit code sent to this phone, followed directly by the Authentication PIN you have already set up.
step3.text6: The 'Help us keep your device secure' page registers your device to allow it to access UBS Resources. Tap 'Register'.

step4.heading: Set PIN for Office 365 applications
step4.text1: Tap 'Maybe Later' on the 'Add Another Account' page. You may also see a three-slide tour of the application's features which can be skipped.
step4.text2: A notification that UBS is protecting data in this app will appear. Tap 'OK'.
step4.text3: You will then be asked to set an additional PIN. This PIN is used across all your Office 365 mobile applications and is different to the Authentication PIN (or SMS code) that you received earlier.
step4.text4: This new PIN must be at least eight characters long, contain least one number, one letter and one special character. The PIN must not contain repeating characters (e.g. AA) or numerical sequences (e.g. 123).
step4.text5: Re-enter your new PIN to confirm and proceed.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: Your UBS mailbox is ready to use. Tap 'Turn On' to enable Notifications if you would like to.
step5.text2: Tap the circular icon at the top left to navigate to the folder view.
step5.text3: Your email folder list is then visible.

step1.heading: Install Applications
step1.text1: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal Apps are required in order to use Outlook on your Android device.
step1.text2: If you have not already done so please download and install these Apps, including Outlook, from the Google Play Store.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App. There is also no requirement to sign into the Authenticator application, but you must have both of these apps downloaded to your mobile device.

step2.heading: Install Outlook and Add your account
step2.text1: Install the Microsoft Outlook application.
step2.text2: If Outlook finds and offers to add previous email addresses to this account, deselect these and select 'Skip'.

step3.heading: Sign in and verify your account
step3.text1: You may be asked to choose your Account Type. If so please select 'Office 365' rather than 'Outlook'.
step3.text1a: You will be redirected to the UBS sign in page showing your email address. Tap 'Next'.
step3.text2: A verification code will then be sent by SMS to the mobile phone you provided the number for in the pre-requisite Activation step.
step3.text2a: Please note: the SMS sender may be displayed as 'SmsVerify' rather than Microsoft.
step3.text3: Enter the six digit code sent to this phone, followed directly by the Authentication PIN you have already set up.
step3.text5: The 'Help us keep your device secure' page registers your device to allow it to access UBS Resources. Tap 'Register'.

step4.heading: Set PIN for Office 365 applications
step4.text1: Tap 'Skip' on the 'Add Another Account' page. You may also see a three-slide tour of the application's features which can also be skipped.
step4.text2: The 'Get Access' page is displayed. Ensure that four green ticks are displayed, then tap 'Continue'. A notification that UBS is protecting data in this app may also appear. If so, tap 'OK'.
step4.text3: You will then be asked to set an additional PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications and is different to the Authentication PIN (or SMS code) that you received earlier.
step4.text4: This new PIN must be at least eight characters long, contain least one number, one letter and one special character. The PIN must not contain repeating characters (e.g. AA) or numerical sequences (e.g. 123).
step4.text5: Re-enter your new PIN to confirm and proceed.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: Your UBS mailbox is ready to use. Tap Turn On to enable Notifications.
step5.text2: Tap the circular icon at the top left to navigate to the folder view.
step5.text3: The folder list is then visible.

step1.heading: Download and install OneDrive
step1.text1: Download the Microsoft OneDrive application from the App Store and install.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator App is required in order to use OneDrive on your iOS device.
step1.text3: Sign in by entering your email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) and selecting the arrow to continue.

step2.heading: Sign in and verify your account
step2.text1: You will be redirected to the UBS sign in page showing your email address. Tap 'Next'.
step2.text2: A verification code will then be sent by SMS to the mobile phone you provided the number for in the pre-requisite Activation step.
step2.text3: Please note: the SMS sender may be displayed as 'SmsVerify' rather than Microsoft.
step2.text4: Enter the six digit code sent to this phone, followed directly by the Authentication PIN you have already set up.

step3.heading: Application Protection
step3.text1: The checking app status page is displayed. You are prompted that a restart is required. Restart the OneDrive app.
step3.text2: The protecting this app page is displayed. You may receive a prompt: “Your IT admin is now helping you protect work or school data in this app”.

step4.heading: Enter your PIN
step4.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step4.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: The app will now show your UBS OneDrive directory.
step5.text2: You can navigate between Work and Personal OneDrive Accounts by clicking the icon in the top left of the screen.

step1.heading: Download and install OneDrive
step1.text1: Download and Install the Microsoft OneDrive application from the Google Play Store.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal apps are required in order to use OneDrive on your Android device. Please ensure you have downloaded these apps to your personal device before proceeding.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App.
step1.text4: Select 'Sign in' and your account should be found. If not, enter your email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) to sign in.

step2.heading: Application Protection
step2.text1: The 'Get Access' page is displayed. Ensure that four green ticks are displayed, then tap 'Continue'.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step4.heading: Completion
step4.text1: The app will now show your UBS One Drive directory.
step4.text2: You can navigate between Work and Personal One Drive Accounts by clicking the icon in the top left of the screen.

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft Edge
step1.text1: Download the Microsoft Edge application from the Apple App Store and install.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator App is required in order to use Edge on your iOS device.
step1.text3: The app will auto-detect existing accounts to add. Select your UBS account to continue.

step2.heading: App Protection
step2.text1: The checking app status page is displayed. You are prompted that a restart is required. Tap OK and restart the Edge app.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step4.heading: Configure Options
step4.text1: The configuration settings are optional and can be setup as you prefer.

step5.heading: Completion and usage
step5.text1: The three dots in the menu bar at the bottom can be used to access Favourites and Bookmarks.
step5.text2: Access to internet sites whilst logged in with the UBS account is restricted. Whilst signed in with your UBS account, if you attempt to access a restricted website such as gmail.com you’ll be asked to switch to your Personal account.
step5.text3: Edge policies can take up to 24 hours to apply after signing into the app.  This means that you many not have intranet access immediately after your first sign in.

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft Edge
step1.text1: Download and Install the Microsoft Edge application from the Google Play Store.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal Apps are required in order to use Edge on your Android device. Please ensure you have already downloaded these apps to your personal mobile device before continuing.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App.
step1.text4: Select 'Sign in with a work account'. Then select your UBS account to continue.

step2.heading: Application Protection
step2.text1: The 'Get Access' page is displayed. Ensure that four green ticks are displayed and tap 'Continue'.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step4.heading: Configure Options
step4.text1: The Settings, including the ability to view browsing history across devices are optional. Configure your Notifications as preferred.

step5.heading: Completion and usage
step5.text1: The three dots in the menu bar at the bottom can be used to access Favourites and Bookmarks.
step5.text2: Access to internet sites whilst logged in with the UBS account is restricted. Whilst signed in with your UBS account, if you attempt to access a restricted website such as gmail.com you’ll be asked to switch to your Personal account.
step5.text3: Edge policies can take up to 24 hours to apply after signing into the app.  This means that you many not have intranet access immediately after your first sign in.

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft Word
step1.text1: Download the Microsoft Word application from the Apple App Store and install.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator App is required in order to use Word on your iOS device.

step2.heading: App Protection
step2.text1: You may be prompted that your organisation is protecting data in the app. Tap 'OK' and restart the app.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step4.heading: Configure Options & Completion
step4.text1: The configuration settings are optional and can be setup as you prefer.

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft Word
step1.text1: Download and Install the Microsoft Word application from the Google Play Store.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal Apps are required in order to use Word on your Android device. Please ensure you have downloaded these apps to your personal device before proceeding.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App.

step2.heading: Add your Account and sign in
step2.text0: Skip this step if you find your account has been added automatically.
step2.text1: If the account is not added automatically click the person icon in the top right of the screen.
step2.text3: Enter your email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) and select 'Sign in'.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text3: The 'Configuring Office' screen is then displayed.

step4.heading: Options and Completion
step4.text1: Tap through the options displayed.
step4.text2: The icon in the top left allows you to view the active accounts. The bottom menu shows the navigation.

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft OneNote
step1.text1: Download and install the Microsoft OneNote application from the Apple App Store.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator App is required in order to use OneNote on your iOS device.
step1.text3: Launch OneNote and you will be prompted that your organisation is protecting data in the app.

step2.heading: App setup
step2.text1: Tap 'Get Started'.

step3.heading: Enter your PIN
step3.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step3.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step4.heading: Configure Options & Completion
step4.text1: Tap 'OK' to keep track of your notes and 'Allow' notifications if desired.
step4.text2: On the choose your notebooks page, select the notebooks you want to display in the app.
step4.text5: Tap 'More Notebooks' if you want to open further notebooks in the app (including personal).

step1.heading: Download and install Microsoft OneNote
step1.text1: Download and Install the Microsoft OneNote application from the Google Play Store.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal Apps are required in order to use OneNote on your Android device.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App.
step1.text5: The 'Welcome to OneNote' page is shown.
step1.text6: Enter your UBS email address and tap Next.

step2.heading: Notifications
step2.text1: A prompt is displayed 'Allow OneNote to access your contacts'.
step2.text2: You can tap 'Deny', this is not required for your UBS account.

step3.heading: App Protection
step3.text1: You may receive a prompt: Your Organisation is protecting data in this app, restart to continue. If so, tap 'OK' and restart the OneNote app.
step3.text2: The 'Get Access' page is displayed. Ensure that four green ticks are displayed and tap 'Continue'.

step4.heading: Enter your PIN
step4.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step4.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: Your NoteBook is now open. This OneNote notebook is synchronised to your personal OneDrive, it is different to the OneNote notebook on your UBS Workspace desktop (which is saved in your Home/P: drive).
step5.text2: Personal Notebooks can also be opened by selecting the More Notebooks option.

step1.heading: Download and install Teams
step1.text1: Download the Microsoft Teams application from the Apple App Store and install.
step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator App is required in order to use Teams on your iOS device.
step1.text3: Your email address should already be populated, tap it to sign in.
step1.text4: If not, enter your email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) and select 'Sign in'.

step2.heading: App Configuration
step2.text1: On the configure Notifications prompt tap 'Allow'.
step2.text2: At the prompt: Teams would like to access the microphone tap 'OK'.

step3.heading: App Protection
step3.text1: You will be prompted that your organisation is protecting data in the app.

step4.heading: Enter your PIN
step4.text1: If this is the first app you have activated with your UBS account, you will be prompted to create and confirm a PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.
step4.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: Tap 'Next' through the info screens, then tap 'Got it'.
step5.text2: The bottom menu can be used to navigate through the app functions.

step1.heading: Download and install Teams

step1.text2: The Microsoft Authenticator and Intune Company Portal Apps are required in order to use Teams on your Android device. Please ensure you have downloaded both of these apps to your personal device before continuing.
step1.text3: You should not sign into the Intune Company Portal App.

step2.heading: Sign in
step2.text1: Your email address should already be populated. If not, re-enter your email address (firstname.lastname@ubs.com) and select 'Sign in'.

step4.text2: If you have already activated another app with your UBS account, you will be prompted to enter the PIN. This PIN is used across all Office 365 applications.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: Tap 'Next' through the info screens, then tap 'Got it'.
step5.text2: The bottom menu can be used to navigate through the app functions.

mobilePass.heading2: Please note, you should install UBS MobilePass unless instructed otherwise.
mobilePass.latestApp: This is the latest application - use this.
mobilePass.phaseOut: This version is being phased out. Only use this if instructed to.
mobilePass.notEntitle: You are not yet entitled to use UBS MobilePass
mobilePass.requestMessage1: Request with reference {{value}} is submitted and pending approval.
mobilePass.requestMessage2: Request can take 24-36 hours to be generated.
mobilePass.landingNote1: Jailbroken and rooted devices will be blocked.
mobilePass.iOSCondition: iOS 11.0.x or higher with biometric authentication (fingerprint or facial recognition) is required.
mobilePass.androidCondition: Android 8.0 or higher with biometric authentication (fingerprint or facial recognition) is required.

step1.heading: Biometric requirements
step1.text1: Skip this step if you use biometric authentication (fingerprint or facial recognition).
step1.text2: Enable biometrics on your device by consulting your manufacturers' documentation.
step1.text3: Enable biometrics on your device by

step2.heading: Install VeridiumID
step2.text1: Download VeridiumID from the App Store. Once installed, if prompted, allow notifications.
step2.text2: Download VeridiumID from the Google Play Store. Once installed, if prompted allow notifications.

step3.heading: Vouch keys
step3.text1: Two colleagues must vouch for you by visiting
step3.text3: Once the vouch keys have been generated they are valid for one hour only.
step3.text4: Please make a note of these vouch keys for the next step.
step3.text5: More information on vouching can be found

step4.heading: QR code
step4.text1: Launch the VeridiumID application and select Scan QR Code
step4.text2: Scan the QR Code below with your device.
step4.text3: Then enter your vouch keys from the previous step.

step5.heading: Completion
step5.text1: The registration is now complete and you can now use VeridiumID to log on to your sessions.

step1.heading: Biometric requirements
step1.text1: Skip this step if you already use biometric authentication (fingerprint or facial recognition).
step1.text2: Enable biometrics on your device by consulting your manufacturers' documentation.
step1.text3: Enable biometrics on your device by

step2.heading: Install UBS MobilePass
step2.text1: Download and install UBS MobilePass from the App Store.
step2.text2: Download and install UBS MobilePass from the Google Play Store.
step2.text3: Once installed, launch, consent and if prompted, allow notifications.

step3.heading: Login
step3.text1: You have the correct entitlements to use UBS MobilePass. Your username is:
step3.text2: Enter this username to login to UBS MobilePass.
step3.text3: If you forget your username you can always

step4.heading: Vouch
step4.text1: Ask two colleagues to vouch for you by generating
step4.text3: When the vouch keys have been generated, they are valid for one hour.
step4.text4: Once you have obtained the vouch keys, proceed to the next step.
step4.text5: More information on vouching can be found

step5.heading: Setup
step5.text1: Allow the use of your contacts, location and your device's camera when prompted.
step5.text2: Allow the use of your contacts, location and your device's camera when prompted.
step5.text3: You will then be asked to authenticate with biometrics. Once you have done this, select 'Continue'. Close the application to proceed.

step6.heading: Completion
step6.text2: Select 'Login using UBS MobilePass' on your IT Anywhere login screen.
step6.text3: Scan the QR code with UBS MobilePass.

remoteHealth.disclaimerText: some features of this page may not be functional for Apple macOS users. The issue will soon be resolved, check back later for the full picture of your remote working health.
remoteHealth.sectionSubTitle: Check the health of your personal machine to ensure you get the best experience when working remotely.
remoteHealth.noDataFound: Your personal device is up to date and suitable for you to work remotely.
remoteHealth.noSoftware: Software is up to date and suitable for you to work remotely.
remoteHealth.noDataLink: For more information view the FAQs on Working Remotely.

action.whatDo: What do I need to do?

software.panelTitle3: Your Citrix HDX RealTime Media Engine

panel1.supportText: The Operating System on this device is compatible for UBS remote working.
panel1.notSupportText1: You are connecting from an Operating System that is not compatible for UBS remote working. To change or upgrade the OS on your device, please refer to your manufacturer's instructions.
panel1.notSupportText2: For information on what Operating Systems are supported see the full article.
panel1.tooltip1: To access your UBS virtual desktop while working remotely, your personal device (e.g. home PC or laptop) must be running a UBS-compatible Operating System). The UBS-compatible OS isn't necessarily the most recent OS released by a vendor.

panel2.supportText: You are running a certified version of Citrix Workspace application which is supported by UBS for remote working.
panel2.notSupportText1: We have detected that you are running an uncertified version of the Citrix Workspace application which is not supported by UBS for remote working.
panel2.notSupportText2: The UBS Citrix Workspace app requires version {{value}}.
panel2.notSupportText3: Visit ubs.com/itanywhere on your personal device's browser and click "Show information for this computer" for instructions on how to update.
panel2.tooltip1: Citrix Workspace application (previously called Citrix Receiver) is the main application installed on your personal device that allows you to connect to your UBS desktop. The UBS-certified Citrix Workspace application isn't necessarily the most recent software released by Citrix.

panel3.supportText: You are running a certified version of Citrix HDX RealTime Media Engine which is supported by UBS for remote working.
panel3.notSupportText1: We have detected that you are running an uncertified version of the Citrix HDX RealTime Media Engine which is not supported by UBS for remote working.
panel3.notSupportText2: UBS Citrix HDX RTME requires version {{value}}.
panel3.notSupportText3: Visit ubs.com/itanywhere on your personal device's browser and click "Show information for this computer" for instructions on how to update.
panel3.tooltip1: Citrix HDX RealTime Media Engine is the application installed on your personal device responsible for the quality of your Skype audio and video calls when working remotely. The UBS-certified Citrix HDX RTME version isn't necessarily the most recent software released by Citrix.

panel1.supportText: Your audio headset is supported by UBS for remote working.
panel1.notSupportText1: We have detected that your connected audio device is not supported by UBS for remote working.
panel1.notSupportText2: View a list of UBS-approved headsets or read more for instructions on how to order a new one.
panel1.tooltip1: Whether you're in the office or working remotely, having a UBS-approved headset will ensure that your audio quality is at its best.

panel2.supportText: Your monitor's resolution is supported by UBS for remote working.
panel2.notSupportText1: We have detected that the monitor configuration on your personal device is not optimal for remote working.
panel2.notSupportText2: UBS supports a maximum of two monitors for remote working.
panel2.notSupportText3: Ensure your setup conforms to the following specification(s):
panel2.notSupportText5: UBS recommends a screen with minumum resolution of 1280x720 to be productive when working remotely.
panel2.notSupportText7: Total resoution should not exceed 3480 x 2160
panel2.notSupportText9: Total resolution should not exceed 6960 x 2160
panel2.tooltip1: The number of monitors you use and their resolution can impact your technology experience when working remotely.

panel1.supportText: The network connection between your personal device and your UBS virtual desktop is optimum for remote working.
panel1.notSupportText1: We have detected that the network connection between your personal device and UBS virtual desktop is sub-optimal. You may experience a delay while clicking or typing on your virtual desktop when working remotely.
panel1.notSupportText2: Ensure you have a stable internet connection
panel1.notSupportText3: Use a wired connection where possible (e.g by connecting a LAN cable between your router and personal device)
panel1.notSupportText4: If you need to use a Wi-Fi (wireless) connection, ensure that other devices like streaming services and gaming consoles are not in use.
panel1.tooltip1: If your internet connection is poor, your experience when working remotely will be negatively affected i.e. a delay when clicking or typing.

video.description: UBS Tube - here is a description
video.title: UBS Tube
video.ul3: Install UBS My Hub on mobile
video.ul4: Install Skype for business on mobile
video.ul8: Become a Skype for Business Large Meeting Expert

video-1.description: With many of us currently working remotely, small changes we make can vastly improve the quality of our technology services - especially Skype for business, links below included the latest recommended headsets and how to install Skype for business on your mobile device.

video-2.description: This short video shows how-to setup your personal workstation to enable you to logon remotely onto your workstation using UBS MobilePass as the authentication method. Links below include instructions on how to activate UBS MobilePass. Visit 'www.ubs.com/remoteaccess' on your personal device.

video-3.description: This short video shows how-to setup your personal workstation to enable you to logon remotely onto your workstation using UBS MobilePass as the authentication method. Links below include instructions on how to activate UBS MobilePass. Visit 'www.ubs.com/remoteaccess' on your personal device.

video-4.description: This short video shows how-to setup your personal iPad to enable you to logon remotely onto your workstation using UBS MobilePass as the authentication method. Links below include instructions on how to activate UBS MobilePass. Visit 'www.ubs.com/remoteaccess' on your personal device.

video-5.description: Teams is a collaboration app that helps your team stay organized and have conversations—all in one place.

video-6.description: Teams are groups of people brought together for work, projects, or common interests. Teams are made up of two types of channels—standard (available and visible to everyone) and private (focused, private conversations with a specific audience). Each channel is built around a topic like 'Team Events,' a department name, or just for fun. Channels are where you hold meetings, have conversations, and work on files together.

video-7.description: A few steps can help you have better, more productive meetings.

video-8.description: Join a Teams meeting from your calendar, via dial-in number and conference ID, or sign in as a guest on the web.

video-9.description: Start 1:1 or group calls — no matter where you are in Teams.

video-10.description: Start 1:1 or group chats to collaborate with a smaller group or to talk privately, and pin chats for quick access.

video-11.description: Create and format a post to start a conversation in a channel.

video-13.description: How to stay in flow with follow-ups and mentions in Word maintain your train of thought by leaving follow-ups in the document, and bring others into the conversation by mentioning them directly into the canvas.

video-14.description: Collaborate online in Word. With Office 365, share your document and quickly collaborate with others no matter where you are.

video-15.description: With Office 365 for business, connect employees to the people, information, and content they need to do their best work, from any device.

video-16.description: Wherever you're working in Office 365, it's simple to share your documents.

video-17.description: Creating, opening and saving files works the same way across Office desktop apps.

video-18.description: Use @mentions in a comment to get someone's attention, like for feedback or for more information, exactly where you want the help

video-19.description: Want to stretch your limits? Take on the green challenges and become a #ZeroHero. You must have My Hub on Mobile installed.

video-20.description: Skype tips for meetings with external parties, including setting up meetings with external attendees, how to admit external participants, and how to make an external participant a presenter.

gt-connect-video.description: Keep up with the latest news and event from across GT. Share your thoughts and ideas. Post photos and videos. Network with colleagues by commenting and liking – all on the move.

portalFeedback.AlertInfoText: Do not use feedback to create or escalate an incident or request. We are unable to respond individually to each feedback submission.
portalFeedback.FeedbackTypeHeading: What type of feedback would you like to offer?
portalFeedback.SuggestionHeading: What would you like to see improved?
portalFeedback.MyHubPortalDesc: The My Hub portal brings together your technology tools in one convenient place. My Hub is a one-stop self-help platform for rapid support on your tech queries.
portalFeedback.MyHubExternalDesc: The My Hub external site is a safety net if you’re working remotely. Delivering My Hub functionality through an external internet site.
portalFeedback.MyHubMobileDesc: My Hub Mobile ist eine komfortable Möglichkeit, auf Ihre My Hub Seite zuzugreifen, während Sie nicht an Ihrem Computer zu Hause arbeiten. Sie haben Zugriff auf die Funktionen von My Hub mit Ihrem IOS- oder Android-Gerät.
portalFeedback.MyHubLiteDesc: The My Hub panel shows you your service status and notifications at a glance. It also includes a tool for changing and resetting your password.
portalFeedback.CommentLabel: Please enter your comment - do not enter CID

ppm.SubmissionFeedback: Your feedback has been submitted, thank you!
